office: House Committee on Education and Labor (Democratic staff)
key_responsibilities: organizing oversight hearings
writing investigative reports
executing a complementary legislative and oversight strategy with positive results
requirements: J.D. and relevant policy experience with at least 3-5 years of experience conducting investigations

office: House Committee on Education and Labor (Democratic staff)
key_responsibilities: drafting press releases and remarks
coordinating press activities with Committee offices
managing the Committee website
compiling and distributing press clips
tracking press and social media analytics
supporting a wide range of other communications work
requirements: ability to work effectively in a team environment

key_responsibilities: developing legislative initiatives
meeting with constituents and interested groups on behalf of the Congresswoman
staffing the Congresswoman for committee hearings and markups
requirements: at least 3 years of Hill experience
strong understanding of Social Security, Defense, Foreign Affairs, Housing, and other legislative issues
ability to work well with a team in a small, fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: front office duties, including answering and screening telephone calls, mail distribution, room reservations, and responding to constituent requests for flags, tours, and other information
recruiting, training, scheduling and assigning intern duties
requirements: significant experience interacting with the public
working knowledge of the District of Columbia
resident of the District of Columbia or willing to move immediately to D.C.
salary: based on skill and experience level

key_responsibilities: assisting in the development of policy positions and legislative initiatives
managing and supervising the office's legislative staff
managing and coordinating the messaging and communications activities, including media contacts, for the Member and the office
managing traditional and digital communications including press statements, press releases, mass emails, social media posts, and website updates
developing and planning legislative initiatives
monitoring legislative developments within Committees and on the House floor
tracking legislation, executive action, administrative action, and other governmental developments
drafting constituent correspondence for the Member
preparing for committee meetings and hearings
answering constituent letters
helping constituents with federal matters
managing front desk operations
answering telephones
greeting visitors
coordinating tours for visiting guests
processing flag requests
reviewing, sorting, and responding to incoming constituent correspondence
addressing constituent matters
assisting the Member and legislative staff as needed
management of the website and social media activities
drafting social media and outreach content
filming, taking photos, and occasionally producing graphics and videos
requirements: excellent oral and written communication skills

key_responsibilities: supporting the Chairwoman and lead a small team to support the policy direction of the Africa Subcommittee by implementing the legislative and oversight agenda
drafting legislation
developing policy and communications objectives
managing implementation of Subcommittee hearings and briefings
drafting official letters, memoranda, and investigative reports
helping publicize activities and investigative findings
organizing and acting as lead staff on Congressional Delegations abroad
managing, mentoring, and directing Subcommittee staff
serving as primary support for Subcommittee Members and staff
coordinating with the House Foreign Affairs Committee staff
requirements: clear background in foreign policy, with a specific expertise on the continent of Africa
strong network of ties in the foreign affairs policy community
strong leadership skills and verifiable experience managing a team
robust verbal and written communication skills
ability to manage multiple projects at one time in a fast-paced environment
deep understanding of the Hill and a proven track record of achieving policy goals

key_responsibilities: managing a fast-paced schedule for a Member of Congress
processing all incoming schedule requests and arranging travel
working closely with Member, Chief of Staff, and District Director in advancing priorities of the office
requirements: experience managing a fast-paced schedule for a Member of Congress
ability to work as part of a team
reasonable flexibility and availability beyond normal office hours

key_responsibilities: advancing the Congressman’s legislative priorities and supporting his work on the Judiciary and Education and Labor Committees
requirements: substantial experience working on a variety of issues, including education, health, employment, labor, transportation, appropriations, housing, and other issues that impact majority-minority communities
strong oral and written communication skills
ability to work well under pressure
extensive knowledge of the legislative process
previous House-side Hill experience and extensive legislative acumen
JD and previous experience serving as a Legislative Director or senior policy staff

office: House Committee on Education and Labor (Democratic staff)
key_responsibilities: providing expert advice on labor economics, and supporting policy making initiatives in health, education and human services
communicating data and findings in an accessible manner to a non-technical audience
assisting labor, health and education policy staff to draft legislation
preparing materials for hearings, markups and floor activity
drafting memos
conducting research, tracking and reporting on labor market and macroeconomic developments
coordinating appropriations and budget related matters
evaluating regulatory proposals
tracking other committees’ activities that intersect with the Ed and Labor Committee
providing cost/budget justifications for policy priorities
coordinating with oversight and communications teams in support of the Committee’s agenda
requirements: at least 5 years of experience as a professional economist
strong writing, communication, and organizational skills
ability to successfully manage multiple projects under deadlines

office: House Committee on Education and Labor (Democratic staff)
key_responsibilities: providing expert advice
advancing legislation and providing oversight on workplace safety and health
supporting policy making where workplace safety issues cross cut with the Committee’s initiatives in health, education and human services
drafting legislation
organizing and preparing materials for hearings, markups and floor activity
drafting memos
researching, tracking and reporting on workplace safety and health developments
engaging with other committees and the full array of stakeholders
evaluating regulatory and legislative proposals from relevant agencies
coordinating with oversight and communications teams in support of the Committee’s agenda
requirements: degree in a relevant discipline or at least 3 years of experience in Congress, a regulatory agency, union or other organization working on health and safety issues
ability to anticipate emerging issues, support build support for initiatives, and successfully communicate safety and health information in an accessible manner to a non-technical audience
exceptional writing, communication, and organizational skills
ability to successfully manage multiple projects under tight deadlines
commitment to social justice and expanding economic opportunity

office: Progressive California Democrat and member of the House Ways and Means Committee
key_responsibilities: preparing and staffing the Member in committee hearings and markups
developing and advancing legislation and other policy priorities of the Member
researching and advising the Member on policy issues and vote recommendations
drafting talking points and speeches
representing the Member in meetings and events
requirements: capacity to produce high-quality work in a fast-paced environment
ability to synthesize complex technical information under tight deadlines
ability to work well with a variety of competing interest groups

key_responsibilities: advising the Chairwoman, Members, and staff on the rules and procedures of the Committee
assisting senior staff in overseeing the legislative activities of the Committee
preparing for hearings, markups, and floor activity
tracking legislation
drafting and editing Committee documents
requirements: ability to work well under pressure and short deadlines
prior Hill experience and/or a strong understanding of the House Rules

office: House Select Subcommittee on the Coronavirus Crisis majority staff
key_responsibilities: developing and implementing the Select Subcommittee’s communications strategy across digital and traditional media
drafting press releases and other materials
responding to media inquiries
coordinating interviews and press events
preparing the Chairman for these events
requirements: ability to work well under pressure
excellent written and oral communication skills

key_responsibilities: Handles casework assignments
Maintains a good working relationship with the Member, staff, and constituents
Acts as the representative for the Member within his or her area of responsibility
Informs the Member and the District Director of all happenings in his or her assigned issue areas
Acts as a liaison to local, state, and federal officials
Acts as a liaison to and notifies the appropriate media
Assesses casework for problems requiring legislative action and makes recommendations
Monitors scheduled district meetings for the Member with constituents
Screens and refers cases, when appropriate, to other district offices
Trains and supervises Staff Assistants
Logs in all incoming and outgoing mail and incoming telephone calls relating to casework
Prepares periodic reports for the District Director on pending cases and district activities
Continually screens active cases and acts as liaison with constituents
Maintains up-to-date files on all cases and categories of information
requirements: At least 5 years of experience; strong academic credentials
Strong oral and written communication skills
Thorough knowledge of local, state, and federal agencies and departments
Knowledge of all issues and events in the district in which the Member is involved
Ability to perform the essential job functions above
Ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
Thoroughness and careful attention to detail
Ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment

office: district office of Congressman Frank Pallone, Jr.
key_responsibilities: constituent casework and community outreach
meeting with local community officials
representing the Congressman at community and governmental events
special projects
general office work
requirements: excellent verbal and written communication skills
Prior experience in government, the non-profit sector, community and grassroots organizing

key_responsibilities: staffing and preparing the Chairman for meetings and events with Members, outside organizations, and other stakeholders
serving as a resource to other offices on Israel/Middle East and other issues
writing statements and briefing materials
drafting legislation where appropriate
meeting with stakeholders both with and without the Chairman
requirements: deep understanding of issues relating to Israel and the relevant stakeholders
ability to work closely and collaboratively with others
